page.title: 05A Villager's Memories
page.content: Mr Woodrow came to the school and talked about Curry Rivel. He is nearly 70 years old, so he could tell us a lot about the good and the bad days. He told us about Club Day which happened once a year. There were side stalls, merry-go-rounds and other things. If the children helped put the funfair out they would have a free ride in the horse and cart. First of all on Club Day the people marched around the village and then had a drink and after that they went to a church service and fell asleep! Every month they paid a shilling to join the Club. Curry Rivel School was built in 1876. When Mr Woodrow went to school there were 160 children in the school and the children were up to 14 years old, and then they had to find work.
